title: Towards circular plastics within planetary boundaries - Nature.com
summary: This study investigates the planetary footprints of various GHG mitigation strategies for global plastic production, including recycling, bio-based production, and production via Carbon Capture and Utilization (CCU). By employing a bottom-up model covering over 90% of global plastic production, the study compares the planetary footprints of these strategies against fossil-based plastics, evaluating their impacts across multiple Earth-system processes within the planetary boundaries framework.
likely_naics_codes: ['325211', 'Plastic and Synthetic Resin Manufacturing', '325199', 'All Other Basic Inorganic Chemical Manufacturing', '325188', 'Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing', '325991', 'All Other Chemical Product Manufacturing']
greenwashing: The study does not describe any products or processes that are likely to be considered greenwashing.
